summary: Every 10 years, the Census Bureau counts the entire population of the United States. Decision-makers use this information to apportion congressional seats and direct federal funds. The last census, in 2020, occurred during COVID-19, which disrupted the Bureau's efforts—risking the quality and accuracy of the count. We reported accuracy issues with the census, including that the Bureau estimated 14 states had significant errors in their...
title: 2020 Census: Coverage Errors and Challenges Inform 2030 Plans
